Adding the stylesheet differently

Adding it via jQuery was firing DOMContentLoaded before all of the CSS
was loaded, thus messing up CSS rules and messing up automatic <select>
styling - see bug #287.  Changing this to document.write to add it immediately
before the jQuery script tag.

Had logic inverted.

Wrote a test for issue #251, found that the logic was wrong, corrected.
See gist for sample code: https://gist.github.com/4539248

Bugfix to address issue #251

The div/span should only be hidden if the element itself is hidden.
Previously the div/span were hidden if the element was hidden by itself or
by any parent.  For the case of jQueryUI and multiple tabs, the non-showing
tabs are all hidden and this was causing Uniform to hide the div/span.
When the tab was shown, the div/span would not be unhidden.

I believe this change will fix the problem.
Removing unused variable
Updating to match library
Removing debugging code

Fixing bug #256

The code checked if the click event was for any div or span.  That was used
to make sure we didn't simulate a click on the child element.  Instead we now
just set a variable to prevent infinite recursion and fire the click event.
Fixing active button cap

Correcting high contrast detection for Chrome

Elements can't attach to 'body' during the initial loading of the script.
Postponing detection of high contrast mode until the first uniform() call.

This addresses an IE issue.  Yes, the browser is actually broken, but
we should still try to compensate for it a little if we can.

Reorganizing functions, minor tweaks

Because it is hard to see the changes, I've done the following:

* Mostly alphabetized the functions except when there is a dependency
* Cleaned up a couple comments

Adding code from issue #104

Older versions of Firefox don't send click events or follow links properly.  This code is provided in the bug report to fix this issue.

Adding in website files and build scripts

Putting the website in the development branch with a build script so we can update themes, test them with the debug page, see how the site would render, then just build a tarball and update the gh-pages branch with the changes.  This also removes duplicate documentation for the options and helps to keep things up to date.

Importing Agent theme from Collin Allen

I also changed the license to MIT with his blessing.  Here's a slightly censored email:

Subject: Re: Agent theme for Uniform
References: <CAPf=UYYYcY-zM9Q4sEZuNVvQ3WSUd1vvqnB0GF2q3TDBWxf0fg@mail.gmail.com>
From: Collin Allen <collin@comma******.com>
In-Reply-To: <CAPf=UYYYcY-zM9Q4sEZuNVvQ3WSUd1vvqnB0GF2q3TDBWxf0fg@mail.gmail.com>
Message-Id: <DCC10F96-6FE2-4506-8568-11B5F075DD1E@comma******.com>
Date: Fri, 12 Oct 2012 08:41:38 -0700
To: Tyler Akins <******@gmail.com>

Hi Tyler,

I think, at the time, I just used the same license as the other Uniform themes, but I could be mistaken. In any, event, though, feel free to relicense it under MIT :) Not a big deal!

Where will this new repository be hosted at?

Thanks!

~ Collin

Sent from my iPad

On Oct 12, 2012, at 6:34 AM, Tyler Akins <******@gmail.com> wrote:

> I would like to include your agent theme in Uniform's repository.  I'm adding support for many other form fields and would like to "hit the ground running" when the next version is released by having more than one theme available for users.  You license the agent theme as creative commons share-alike, which is not the same as Uniform's MIT licensing.  I don't want to have license conflicts by including your theme under a different license.  So, I was hoping that you'd be ok with me relicensing the agent theme under MIT and including it in Uniform's repository.
>
> What are your thoughts?
>
> --
> Tyler Akins

Merge pull request #237 from superp/master

fix css  filter: alpha(opacity=0)

use '=' in alpha(opacity=0) not ':'

When I try build my Rails 3.2 project, I get error:
Invalid CSS after "...: alpha(opacity": expected comma, was ":0);"

To fix this error I change this line in css:
 filter: alpha(opacity=0); /* use '=' here, not ':' */
